content:
Hi!

I upgraded my server's distro to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, and now zulip-tornado cannot start due to a socket error I think. Has anybody encountered that problem before?
The issue seems that Zulip doesn't work with Python 3.10

Did you follow all steps of our documentation on upgrading the operating system? (We haven’t specifically documented Ubuntu 20.04 → 22.04 yet, but you should be able to roughly follow the Ubuntu 18.04 → 20.04 instructions with appropriate substitutions.)
See, I didn't even know there were these steps :'(
I'll follow them right now, hoping there is no damage :'(
I did select N to all options at least when upgrading!
It’s probably okay, as long as you’re running server 5.3 or later (5.3 was our first release to support Ubuntu 22.04).
@Anders Kaseorg thanks a lot for the pointers, it fixed everything. FYI the same instructions for 18.04 to 20.04 work fine for 20.04 to 22.04!
Étienne Machabée has marked this topic as resolved.
I wonder if there is a way we could ensure folks see that documentation when upgrading the OS.
Either in terms of our error messages or a hook into the OS upgrade system.
